10 Designers, 10 Qualities

 Jul 17, 2024

Daniel Eatock

Eatock employs a conceptual, "procedural" approach that prioritizes logic and systems over traditional aesthetic choices. His work often uses self-referential humor and everyday objects to challenge the role of the designer as a visual stylist.

Frank Chimero

Chimero focuses on the narrative and emotional resonance of design, blending thoughtful prose with a human-centric visual style. He is highly regarded for his ability to articulate the "why" behind creative work, treating design as a bridge between function and delight.
